website_summaries.verdict: A perfect assembly clamp to hold 90-degree angles together for securing. Acts as an extra hand for solo woodworkers.
pros: Ability to “swivel” a bit, which is helpful when assembling frames or cabinet angles
Can tilt to hold different wood thicknesses
cons: Limits the size of what can be clamped
shims may help ensure a secure fit
Some users prefer a clamp that doesn’t give or shift when tightened
Doesn’t work as well on larger-dimension lumber

customer_reviews.title: Can Do Clamp Can Done! just get it!
customer_reviews.text: Great corner Clamp for putting two boards of different thickness together so that the glue can dry. Really impressed by how the Corner doesn't sit on the clamp so that you don't have to worry about dripping glue or the clamp getting glued to the boards! When I Clamp I use the Can-Do Clamp for the bottom corner, and a smaller corner Clamp for the top 1/2. I picked up a knock off Clamp at Harbor Freight, but Amazon has the Bessey version that goes well with the Can Do Clamp. Bessey WS-3 Angle Clamp  Together they make a great pair. Love my Can Do!
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley Geek

customer_reviews.title: ... the first time I tested them I realized how bad the handle design is
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for an upcoming book case project and the first time I tested them I realized how bad the handle design is. Unless you have the handle hanging off the edge of the workbench, you can only tighten the clamp half a turn. Then you have to slide the bar back and tighten it another half turn. Terrible design. I removed the tightening bar and made Bessy style handles. The clamps are so much easier to use now. They seem like they will work for squaring up the bookcase for assembly. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Broke under pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a project that got postponed and can no longer return it. Upon first use it snapped where it matters most. The grips are designed poorly which allows for wiggle room. I had to over tighten it to hold the material steady and the lightweight aluminum that this clamp is made of gave into the force. Although this tool would be handy for light framing, it is not suitable for larger applications, or for use a table clamp.
customer_reviews.author: BigMan1980

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 90* angles!
customer_reviews.text: Used these to build some frames to stretch canvas over. I tested a few pieces of scrap to make sure the corners would be square. I placed two 1"x2" boards in the clamp haphazardly and tightened down the clamp and put a couple of brads in to secure them, then measured. Using a quick layout square, I found a perfectly square connection. The boards self-centered and came together right where I needed them. The clamps have some weight to them too and have slots to mount them to a bench for repeatable jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome addition to my tool collection
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome addition to my tool collection. Very versatile and easy to use. It's made out of a strong metal material and the tightening screw is very smooth. The clamp is definitely high quality. I'm using it in conjunction with a kreg jig to make perfect joints on cornhole boards. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Quality design
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made. My 90 degree work is much more productive since I got this. It swivels a little as it tightens adding to its useful design - not fixed and stiff. A little wiggle room can make a difference. My wife sometimes uses it for her hobby work.
customer_reviews.author: Em K

customer_reviews.title: Works but marks up wood with red paint
customer_reviews.text: The camp does seem to get you right angle alignments quite well. However after testing it once for function I noticed as I pulled out the two pieces of sanded wood that at least one of them was heavily marked with the red paint used on the clamp/jig. See if Hi-Fi. This isn’t acceptable as one would have already fine sanded the wood one is assembling and not easily sanded again to remove the paint marks. Rather than paint maybe the metal should have been covered with a harder nonmaring treatment. So it’s a fail and return for me.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well but handle is not ergonomic. Awkward and takes forever to close
customer_reviews.text: Works as posted. Once you get the wood properly aligned. Only complaint is the awkward closing mechanism. More specifically the bar you have to turn to close it is long, while laying on a flat surface you have to keep sliding it back and forth which makes it take a long time to fully close down onto the wood
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great item, used often, great price/quality
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had these years ago. It is funny how some things are used so often after you purchase them. These little clamps are well built for price you pay. If you want to do metal work, they might work for very light occasional use...but I would go with larger clamps. I needed a clamp to speed up my wood target making process. The first target took 5 times longer to build, but by the 10 target I was really moving. You need two clamps for the jobs I have used the clamps for. I image will end up purchasing 4 clamps to speed up the production process. The Clamps are easy to store, light, and well built. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Sayers

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Sturdy, Easy to Use. Beware of Red Stain.
customer_reviews.text: These Can-Do Clamps worked well for my bookcase project. They are easy to use and hold the work piece solidly while the glue sets. On my project, I routed 1/4" deep dados into which i set individual shelves (1x12 poplar). The Can-Do Clamps held the shelves at a perfect 90 degree angle. A caveat, however, is that the red paint on the clamps left a red stain on my poplar. This wasn't a problem for me because I plan to paint the shelves anyway. But this may be problematic for some applications.
customer_reviews.author: Bookster

customer_reviews.title: Slide pin handles are annoying.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had purchased the screwdriver handle unfinished clamps instead. These slide pins are annoying because they slide down and snag on the work surface (clamp holes, plastic protection drape, etc) while setting it up or if you have to move it after. Paint comes off easily if you get any glue on it and have to remove it. They are cheap however for a set of 4 so I gave them one more star despite merely acceptable performance. At least they seem to be square.
customer_reviews.author: Powhoundus

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, as advertised, big fan after many projects.
customer_reviews.text: (Update after 10 projects: I bought another one of these and, while it may be overkill, I am so excited to be using these to manage two corners of a project at once. Most recent project I used these to hold three pieces together while I glued them up. Worked great!) This is heavy and reliable to get corners right. I used this for the first time on a box and it made a huge difference in how square it all ended up and is one of my better efforts to date. If you are working with wood that is not always perfectly tru and flat this makes a huger difference. A bargain at twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: irooster

customer_reviews.title: Handle keeps hitting the table making it difficult to clamp quickly
customer_reviews.text: Well-built, heavy duty, and is heavier than a brick. I found it to be square and had no problem managing larger boards. That being said, the biggest design flaw for me is that if it sits flat on a table, there's no fast way to clamp the board because the T handle keeps hitting the table. You'll have to spin it, pull the rod to the other side, then spin again. Rinse and repeat. Avoidable if youre more thoughtful about your setup, but even then, if everything shifts, you're literally going to run into a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Franco Romualdez

customer_reviews.title: perfect angles
customer_reviews.text: 1st, unless you buy 4, one for each corner, it's very hard to get squared. Or unless you have the exact thickness of wood to space up the other corners to make level with the Can-Do Clamp. Also when your tighting you can only go half turns then move the shaft all the way over, then half turn, very times consuming when your trying to make sure everything in the Can-Do Clamp is straight.
customer_reviews.author: Doug H.

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use Used these to build some frames to stretch canvas over. I tested a few pieces of scrap to make sure the corners would be square. I placed two 1"x2" boards in the clamp haphazardly and tightened down the clamp and put a couple of brads in to secure them, then measured. Using a quick layout square, I found a perfectly square connection. The boards self-centered and came together right where I needed them. The clamps have some weight to them too and have slots to mount them to a bench for repeatable jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: This will pay for itself in what youll save on medicine for headaches. You can't beat the price for how well it's built. It clamps stuff, if you dont need to clamp stuff, then this isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tango Lima

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It is very heavy duty however the design does not allow ease of use. It is not designed to allow for ease of use to keep the two pieces up against each other. If you hold one in tight to the other piece of wood this fixture will not allow both pieces to be tight up against each other. I just happened to throw the box away or I would return it. I may find a box that it will fit in and return it anyway. Very hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: moparman49

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t perform its primary function well at all
customer_reviews.text: It really doesn’t do well at holding two surfaces perfectly perpendicular to each other. It’s within a few degrees but if I wanted to be within a few degrees I would not have bought this clamp. Also the rotation knob for loosening/tightening is too big and will hit any surface the clamp is sitting on unless it is on the edge of a table or something.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: I was not asked to review
customer_reviews.text: This worked surprisingly well. I was skeptical based on other reviews, but it held the wood squarely and solidly. Be aware that it’s relatively heavy, so if you are using it in the top of your work, it might make the piece fall over. It takes a little getting used to setting it, but once I figured out out, it was like having an extra set of hands. One thing others reported was red marks on the wood. I had no such problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Works in some cases...
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I can get this clamp to work perfectly, other times it can be a pain. An example I have issues with is taking 2x4's with a 45 degree cut into them and trying to use this clamp to secure it when gluing the 45's together. It always pushes one side out of alignment. It takes some time and a little luck to get some of my projects to fit just right into this clamp. It is decently priced for what it is and does work on projects like the one pictured doing in the advertisement. I gave it three stars but I bounced around between 2 and 3 before settling with 3.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 90 degree clamp for home DIY
customer_reviews.text: I found this product by accident and thought I’d try it. It works a treat, is very easy to use and is easy to bolt down to my workbench. I’ve used it maily to create box frames using 2x4 and it’s perfect for this. The angle is exact every time and makes a tricky DIY job very easy. I can see this being in use in my garage for the next 40 years and it feels built to last.
customer_reviews.author: MrGraingerPA

customer_reviews.title: Great clamp should last a long time
customer_reviews.text: This clamp is great it can easily adjust to fit a two by four in yet can also clamp white wood (1 inch). This feels to be made of heavy duty metal that has a powder coat or similar paint to prevent chipping/rusting. The screw to tighten it is very easy and only needs a slight amount of pressure to hold the two pieces together. So far I haven't had any issues with this but if they develop I will update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Great clamps!
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised how well these are made. The parts are formed well and they fit together, better than I would have expected. You can tell some thought was actually put into the design. Each casting is nice and heavy so I expect that they'll probably last a good long while. Will probably buy a few more.
customer_reviews.author: EYT

customer_reviews.title: Built well, useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. Mounted one to my work table the other I keep on the shelf to use freely. Both are super sturdy and helpful. Getting the boards lined up just right takes a minute but the hold is quite strong. I’ve added additional clamps to boards that I’m joining just to be super accurate. I’ve used it as a regular table vice as well. Works great. Overall, worthy tool and well made. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan1970

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, handy and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's good. It's sturdy. I like the open area at the joint. First time I used it was to square up metal framing for welding. Worked well. Couldn't have welded the frames with some of the jigs out there because of a lack of clearance at the joint. It does take a little effort to get your pieces to mate correctly, as it tends to want to pull them apart as you tighten it. Overall, still rates 5 stars for a home handyman like me. Not sure I'd use it in a production facility but I don't have one of those, so all is good.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Leaves paint, not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing scratches very easily, leaving paint all over the surface you put it on. I'm guessing once the paint rubs off it might start rusting, we'll see. The T-bar handle is not that easy to use, especially if you put it on a flat surface. I would have preferred a simply wooden handle.
customer_reviews.author: Dorian

customer_reviews.title: This is such an amazing tool!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a home video where someone recommended this and it is awesome! I used it to square off the corners on a bookcase that was 8 feet by 8 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Southern gent

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Helper!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this many times already to make quick and easy work of projects around the house; indoors and out. It's sturdy, reliable, and a must-have helper for EVERYONE, whether novice out expert... especially because it creates perfect corner angles even with two DIFFERENT sizes of wood... QUICKLY, easily, evenly, perfectly! Only a fool is soon parted with this tool... Or overlooks/snubs its purchase. LoL
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Deal, Used, at $21.96
customer_reviews.text: Like: I saved a few dollars by buying "used." It was obviously used before it was returned, perhaps several times, with a few nicks in the red paint, and covered in sawdust, but was undamaged and functional. Dislike: None.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Useful clamps
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the clamp about a dozen or so times so far and have had great experience with it. It gets a little difficult when using long pieces of material, and have found that I need to have blocks and such to keep edges from tilting away from each other when tightening clamp. Overall I'm very happy with the clamp so far.
customer_reviews.author: tcole86

customer_reviews.title: Not square
customer_reviews.text: I am a carpenter/builder. I do all the finish work myself. I like making picture frames or hoops for the windows because it is much more efficient. This entails cutting and assembling more or less picture grames. I purchased this jig because it is a great concept. Thinking this would speed up the process as well as make it easier, I was unpleasantly surprised. The jig isn't square at all!! How is this suppose to help? Isnt being square part of the picture frame? The reason for the two star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This clamp is sturdy and holds the re-bar I'm welding with no wiggle.
customer_reviews.text: I received my 2 can-do Clamps today, had to try them to see if they work better than the two I have. They sure do, these clamps grip the 1/2 re-bar I am welding and hold it still and the clamp does not get out of shape as it is built very sturdy. I would recommend this product to anyone who is looking to use it for welding 90 degree corners with re-bar. For other uses I have no experience so can't vouch for those.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: very heavy duty appearance
customer_reviews.text: I just got this at Christmas so have not used it, but I was really amazed at the heavy duty appearance of the tool. I know from the heft and feel that ithis tool is not going to go out of shape on the first project. I can hardly wait to get into the shop with it.
customer_reviews.author: J Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Nice little gadget for your workshop.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little gadget for the workshop. Removes some of the hassle of using clamps and straight edges. But it is a bit small, so there will be a limit to how often you'll be using it. But for small legs and lighter pieces of material, it will work great.
customer_reviews.author: EST. LEE DISPLAY L D 1902

customer_reviews.title: Did the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Did the job well. My only suggestion would be to provide some soft covers for the clamp contact surfaces for use on finished wood surfaces. As-is we had to use some packing foam to cushion it against the veneer furniture we were re-gluing.
customer_reviews.author: Sliver111

customer_reviews.title: great product but will not hold a 2 x4
customer_reviews.text: the tool is a great idea but we needed it to hold a 2 x 4 but it will not open that for. this would be great for small wood projects. But great tool
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Its okay, but is a little annoying at times
customer_reviews.text: Overall its not a bad clamp, but its a little difficult to hold the two pieces of lumber and tighten the clamp, plus the fact that it leaves red paint on everything is very annoying. If not for the paint coming off on everything you put into the clamp, it would easily be 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan  Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Talk about a time saver
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Its well designed, manufactured for durability and accuracy, and gosh does it save you a lot of time. Just wish it came with shems the same thickness as the base of this vice. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tribulation ExodusTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected, haven't had a chance to use it a very much yet but as soon as I held it I could tell Its a solid clamp. all metal and has some weight to it too. I love the design on how it tilts to hold two different thicknesses of of wood. great tool
customer_reviews.author: Carol Moe

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is design to do
customer_reviews.text: Great for what it is design to do. Has it's limitations(great for end joints(2*4 or 1.5inch depth lumber) but has depth limitation for mid joints like T joints. Doesn't have enough clearance for a 1.5 Inch lumber T joint. ) but each tool has it's limitations. Beyond that, the tool is easy to use. Can be used for direct wood screw and also can be used for jig system.
customer_reviews.author: Zheng Tianxi

customer_reviews.title: Great for when you need that 3rd hand!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after the fact. Wish I would have bought it before I started my project. This is perfect for when you need that 3rd hand. Seems to be very sturdy and easy to use. I would definitely recommend to the avid DIY’er.
customer_reviews.author: BIG MAINE II

customer_reviews.title: Paint comes off onto wood
customer_reviews.text: I wish I kept pictures. I bought these months back and just got to using them. The very first time I used them, moderate pressure, my boards had red marks and smears. So disappointing. I will have to cover all the contact surfaces if I ever use them again.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to use this several times, looks good, but next to impossible to use with any success . Sorry to have purchased this item. Keep looking for a better device.
customer_reviews.author: RJB Phillips III

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: I took away one star because it feels a bit clunky to use. That being said I am a beginner at Carpentry so maybe it's just me. It does give perfect 90 degree angles, clamps down on both pieces of wood well. I've only used it a few times but it's helped out those times!
customer_reviews.author: Scray

customer_reviews.title: Great clamps
customer_reviews.text: Great clamps. Easy to use. Made my life a little bit easier when building DIY home furniture. It left some red marks on wood after first use but that is not really an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Edi V

customer_reviews.title: MLCS 9001 Can-Do Clamp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product I would buy it again, and recommend it to anyone who's looking for something like this especially for this low price Works exactly like it should be not much to say about it! It does what it's design/made for. I would recommend to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Laczko Studio

customer_reviews.title: Sure beats the hand held method!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I didn't buy sooner, but this beats the handheld eyeball method by a long shot! Don't need too often but truly worth having when it's needed!
customer_reviews.author: K. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: but are pretty flimsy; probably good for picture frames--I tried to ...
customer_reviews.text: These work ok, but are pretty flimsy; probably good for picture frames--I tried to use them to fit larger lumber, but it's not strong enough for it. I also had one of the pins at the end of the clamp fall out after only a few uses, and now I'll have to try to find a replacement pin.
customer_reviews.author: ESW

customer_reviews.title: Great Clamps and economical..
customer_reviews.text: Great clamps, perfect 90s, self adjusting when you clamp them (still have to guide it into place), and glue wipes off with ease. These clamps are almost all metal, i was tempted to buy some of the others that look the same, but i noticed that they do not have metal over the clamping rod like these do. I recommend these clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Pro-FoodChoice

customer_reviews.title: Great clamp
customer_reviews.text: Made from solid metal, easy to use, feels like a quality tool should. Glad I made the purchase and would do again if I had a time machine.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I had so many issues when trying to use this that I’d rather Just take the time to rig something up rather than use this thing
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Slight design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The lift it gives when setting the wood on it is not ideal. If you purchase multiple and do all the corners at once it wouldn’t be an issue. However, for the price I will take the hassle of shifting wood underneath the end to keep it level when doing each corner.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity and versatile .
customer_reviews.text: Big sturdy clamps that hold decent sized boards securely in place. These clamps have a much larger capacity the most typical miter type clamps do. A must have for your wood-shop.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: I'll admit it not the worlds best at wood working which is why I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit it not the worlds best at wood working which is why I bought this. Great for making the 90's. Don't do a whole lot of work in wood working which is why I bought this versus the Kregg. Find this to be very handy and have no complaints about it.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for predrilling corner joints.
customer_reviews.text: This corner clamp does exactly what you expect it to. If there is one drawback, it's that the deck of the clamp is just a little more than 3/4". I used a scrap piece of 1x3 to level the wood I was working with, but it was a tad short. It's close enough, though, and I didn't take off a star for it.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Strong and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, not flimsy at all, clearances are good, screw glides easy. My only complaints are there is a little play up and down so if you need to really torque it down it's hard to keep it perfectly plumb, and it's too expensive for me to buy as many as I'd like on my budget. For the warped lumber I'm using, I'm glad I went with this one over the cheaper ones I've seen for sale.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cange

customer_reviews.title: Hearty and strong
customer_reviews.text: This is good to use on wood, metal, and even pipe. You can screw it to your work bench or just move it around as you need it since it is heavy enough to keep materials in place.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I use this device mostly to hold pieces together while the glue dries. It has the flexibility to form a shape that holds just about any angle together. Excellent design and construction.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Marold

customer_reviews.title: Corner Clamp
customer_reviews.text: It works good. I used to to make some frames with difference sized pieces and it snugged them up just great. I am happy with my new corner clamp tool.
customer_reviews.author: JA Fred

customer_reviews.title: Really useful
customer_reviews.text: Really helpful tool, especially for holding two 45° cuts together. Wish I knew about this sooner. I bought a second one as im almost always doing multiple at the same time
customer_reviews.author: Brian V

customer_reviews.title: Never Knew I Needed it, Can't Live Without It
customer_reviews.text: I never knew how much I needed one of these clamps until I got one. I use it frequently since purchasing as it takes any guesswork out of building. No matter how sure you are that everything is lined up, a simple bump or shake can ruin it instantly. This fixes that issue and works with a variety of wood sizes.
customer_reviews.author: CuznJay

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my small set of woodworking tools
customer_reviews.text: Nice addition to my small set of woodworking tools. When you want a 90 degree angle connection without positioning a few different clamps and supports, this will get the job done for ya! Works nice with different size wood due to the swivel design on the main part of the clamp (see attached picture)
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good Clamp Overall
customer_reviews.text: It’s a teeny bit on the clunky side, should get 4.5 stars, but 4 it is. Good clamp overall and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Tazman

customer_reviews.title: Regret
customer_reviews.text: Horribly designed handle and left red paint all over my white project. If I hadn't waited too long to use it, I would have shipped it back. Highly priced garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, the best.
customer_reviews.text: With a couple other types of these lay around this is a great improvement and without spending way more $$$ I don't think you can do better, open back and pass through makes it "Nice..".
customer_reviews.author: A. Adams

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my wife so she could easily make some flower boxes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife so she could easily make some flower boxes. She hasn't used it yet, but I gave it a try just for fun. It seems sturdy and well made. It's adjustable so you can use 2 different sized boards. This would be good for making nicely finished frames, or for someone like my wife, who has very little experience with woodworking/power tools.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: One of Those Tools that I Wonder: "How did I ever do anything without this?"
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those tools that I now wonder how I ever did as much as I have done without a tool like this. I'm using it for trellis frames, gates, walk way frames, and almost every time I'm joining one piece of wood at a right angle to another ... butt, lap, or mitered joints. How did I do those before?
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: clamps
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dad who is always building things.....he likes them, but i don't know much about how much he uses them.....
customer_reviews.author: jenjen

customer_reviews.title: Work Well Once it is Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I found that setting the pieces up in the clamp requires some work and patience. Once set-up though, it's great. This is a very solid tool built entirely of metal. It gives me the impression that it will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: Great clamp
customer_reviews.text: After a challenging project trying to get all the corners together on frame, I bought this. It is mostly for me but my husband was very happy with the purchase. We’ve used it now for several projects. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.text: After years of trying to struggle with getting the perfect miter joint, this is that “3rd hand” you wish you could have always had.
customer_reviews.author: D. Likme

customer_reviews.title: No more Wonky Business
customer_reviews.text: HEAVY DUTY! Super cool clamp that my husband will certainly get a lot of use from. No more trying to hold two boards together with your knees and screwing them in wonky. Thanks y’all!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Davis

customer_reviews.title: quality tool
customer_reviews.text: little harder than i thought it would be to insure pieces of wood are flush. Easy to have your frame off a bit if you aren't careful. Other than that quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: square corner maker
customer_reviews.text: I am not good with square corners, this has helped me several times now . hope I don't misplace it.
customer_reviews.author: shirley mathewson

customer_reviews.title: Very good for less than than 2x4’s  in the 3 1/2” direction
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to clamp, and holds your pieces well. A very positive corner clamp for T joints also. Very quick to attach.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great clamp, husband can’t stop talking about it. Highly recommend for wood working.
customer_reviews.author: Tesseva

customer_reviews.title: need an extra hand?!
customer_reviews.text: I have seen these used by certain YouTube video casters and they make perfect sense. Sometimes I need an extra hand when assembling cabinet style projects and these will help tremendously
customer_reviews.author: BobTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty good, if you are trying to do stuff with 2x4's that's as big as I would want to go. It's not perfect, but for the money and most applications, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cal-Tex

customer_reviews.title: Must have for wood workers
customer_reviews.text: If your into wood working and making picture frames, this is a must have for you. It makes things so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought for making Christmas gifts for my daughters. It worked perfect. They loved the handmade “ home sweet home “ copper metal with cedar frame.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Ripperger

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always had problem making frames for projects. Used this to glue it and nail in my corners. Only regret is I should have bought two. So easy to use my wife uses it and it always works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: LouRidge

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and adjustable enough for many jobs
customer_reviews.text: Used this to assist in building a large picture frame for a canvas painting. I was able to use this along with some ingenuity and a couple of trigger type clamps that I already had to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jacan

customer_reviews.title: Nice jig
customer_reviews.text: Great product- clamps different sizes for a perfect corner- I recommend buy two if you’re going to put any really big pieces of wood together
customer_reviews.author: Braeland

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Used these for the first time and fell in love. They hold my corners great and I don't screw them up. I recommend buying two. One for each side of the board.
customer_reviews.author: twocan

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Don't wast your money! Very hard to get things squared up with these.
customer_reviews.author: Dermot L Jones

customer_reviews.title: Being square is good...
customer_reviews.text: when it comes to corners anyway. Easy and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Can do square corners!
customer_reviews.text: Works great to ensure corners are aligned properly. Only complaint is that the grips are only metal and can leave marks on the wood if it's tightened down too much.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Smith

customer_reviews.title: Well built clamp is a must
customer_reviews.text: That extra set of hands you always wanted. Easy, one handed vise action, space on the clamp for access to the wood products, built well, and I've used it for many of my projects. Makes perfectly square boxes, you'll want one.
customer_reviews.author: Civil Servant

customer_reviews.title: Must have jug
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to hold two pieces of wood together and even harder to make sure it's square. Now I know I need at least one more.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Muzaffer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This clamp is so easy and has made my life so much easier and my joints stronger and straighter. I no longer feel like I could use another set of hands.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine65

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: It was a waste of money for me. Trying to tighten wood in place was difficult. The hand needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Giovani

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today, and put it to use right away. I'm 6'-4" and 250lbs, so it's probably a bit small for me, but it seems to be well made. Very inexpensive, lots of pockets and very adjustable for tightness/fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very close to 5 star
customer_reviews.text: You need to be careful when putting down the clamping pressure. Too much pressure makes the angle less than 90 degrees. Great product and quality of product but always make sure that the joint is at a 90 with a speed square or a true 90 tool
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Dang

customer_reviews.title: Spend more to get better jig fro Kreg or Woodpecker
customer_reviews.text: It is so wobbly, it is not funny. Get the angle holder from Kreg or Woodpecker. You get the accuracy. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kanda

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Great product, no issues to report. I’m a beginner but this thing helps me to be precise and make my work line up perfectly. Did not regret the purchase, I may just buy 2 more
customer_reviews.author: keventon Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Very well put together. Made out of better materials than I thought for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gobich

customer_reviews.title: Very Good 90-degree clamp design.
customer_reviews.text: Good, all-metal construction. Having a free end on the workpiece that's not constrained by the clamp gives more options. A lot of clamped surface area and no plastic parts, so it holds the piece securely.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry010101

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: I love this clamp, it has saved me with my woodworking!! Must have!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kyla

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: Where was this clamp when I first started my shelving project? I used it for holding 2x4’s, Upside down, so I could easily screw them together at each corner. Would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not the best corner clamp out there
customer_reviews.text: Just made out of cast aluminum. Light and does what it is designed to do. Not the best corner clamp out there. Works well for butt clamping (like the pic shows). It does come in handy. Not the first corner clamp I reach for.
customer_reviews.author: tell family

product_meta.title: Can-Do Clamp
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Join picture frames or cabinet frames. 2-3/4-Inch width frame capacity. Sliding T-handle for high clamping pressure. Moveable jaws. Oblong mounting holes allow easy mounting to a workbench. Sturdy aluminum construction. Featured and recommended in WOOD magazine (12/1994 issue).
feature_bullets: Can-Do clamp can do it all! A clamp and a vise
Perfect for framing, drilling, doweling, and more

specifications.Warranty Description: 3 Year Warranty on all merchandise. All products are guaranteed against defects in workmanship ans materials.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,672 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
